ImageSource.SourceImageFactory Class Reference

The SourceImageFactory is used to read and write the SourceImage objects directly to the file name specified in Constants.FILE_IMAGES . This is a singleton class, and must be accessed using the getInstance() static method. More...

void addImage (string path, string imageName)
 Adds the specified SourceImage object to the XML file specified in Constants.FILE_IMAGES.
void removeImage (string imageName)
 Removes the specified SourceImage object from the XML file specified in Constants.FILE_IMAGES. All for the image are also removed, using the TagOrganizer.

static SourceImageFactory getInstance ()
static SourceImageFactory getInstance ()
 Returns the single instance of the SourceImageFactory in the running program. Example: 

            //get the instance

Detailed Description

The SourceImageFactory is used to read and write the SourceImage objects directly to the file name specified in Constants.FILE_IMAGES . This is a singleton class, and must be accessed using the getInstance() static method.

Member Function Documentation

void ImageSource.SourceImageFactory.addImage ( string  path,
string  imageName 
)

Adds the specified SourceImage object to the XML file specified in Constants.FILE_IMAGES.

Parameters:
pathThe path of the full path of the file, inclduing file name and file extension.
imageNameThe name of the file, including file extension.
Dictionary<string, SourceImage> ImageSource.SourceImageFactory.getImageList (  )

Returns a list of all images in the ImageSource project.

Returns:
An image list in <![CDATA[Dictionary<string imageName,SourceImage image>]]> format, where 'imageName' is the full file name, and 'image' is the SourceImage object.
static SourceImageFactory ImageSource.SourceImageFactory.getInstance (  ) [static]

Returns the single instance of the SourceImageFactory in the running program. Example: 

            //get the instance
            SourceImageFactory imageFactory = SourceImageFactory.getInstance();.

//the same factory object can now be used to access the file from //any class which has retrieved an instance.

Returns:
The current SourceImageFactory instance.
void ImageSource.SourceImageFactory.removeImage ( string  imageName )

Removes the specified SourceImage object from the XML file specified in Constants.FILE_IMAGES. All for the image are also removed, using the TagOrganizer.

Parameters:
imageNameThe name of the file to be removed, including file extension.
